labels.analysis: The Stellar Blockchain MCP Server is designed to facilitate AI agent interaction with the Stellar blockchain network. Its core functionality revolves around account management, transaction processing, and smart contract interaction. Key features include creating and funding accounts, retrieving transaction history, and signing/submitting Soroban smart contract transactions. The server also supports Passkey wallet integration for secure transaction authorization, making it a comprehensive tool for blockchain operations on the Stellar network.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Cryptocurrency & Blockchain" was chosen because the server's core functionality directly involves blockchain operations, account management, and transaction processing on the Stellar network. The secondary label "API Integration" is included because the server provides a standardized interface for interacting with blockchain operations, acting as a middleware between AI agents and the Stellar blockchain. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories sufficiently cover the server's functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Stellar Blockchain MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @christopherkarani/stellar-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable AI agents to interact seamlessly with the Stellar blockchain network. Perform account management, fund testnet accounts, fetch transaction history, and sign and submit Soroban smart contract transactions through a standardized interface. Integrate with Passkey wallets for enhanced wallet management and transaction authorization.

tools.description: Fetch a minimal set of current info about a Stellar account.

tools.name: get-transactions
tools.description: Fetch an array of transactions for a given Stellar address.

tools.name: sign-and-submit-transaction
tools.description: Sign and submit a Soroban transaction to the Stellar network.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@christopherkarani/stellar-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: agentKeypairFilePath
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: Path to the agent keypair file inside container
